newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Boskalis says orders offer good prospects.
newsitem.headline: Boskalis says orders offer good prospects.

text.p: Dutch dredging group Koninklijke Boskalis Westminster NV said on Thursday that its end-1996 order book was 1.31 billion guilders versus 881 million guilders at the beginning of last year.
"The order book...offers good prospects for 1997," it said in a statement.
Boskalis said the order book increased to 1.5 billion guilders early in 1997 as a result of contract awards.

"Generally the market improved in 1996, especially for trailing suction hopper dredgers, it said, adding that a number of large-scale projects came on stream in the Far Eastern market, particularly in Malaysia and Singapore.
"This has established a solid foundation for the coming years, especially for the West European trailer fleet," it said.
Boskalis added that prices had showed some recovery from 1995 levels, but it said the German and Nigerian markets remained "moderate".
